'''Aravorn''' ({{TA|2497}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}</ref> - {{TA|2654|n}},<ref name="North">{{App|North}}</ref> died aged 157) was the ninth [[Chieftain of the Dúnedain]].

==History==
Aravorn succeeded his father, [[Aragost]], when he died in {{TA|2588|n}}. Aravorn's rule seems to be uneventful as the enemy centered a lot of its attacks on the newly-formed [[Rohan]].

Aravorn died in 2654, after having ruled as chieftain for 66 years, and was succeeded by his son, [[Arahad II]].<ref name="North"/>

==Etymology==
''Aravorn'' is a [[Sindarin]] name. Its meaning is not glossed, but the Association Tolkiendil suggests it means "Black King".<ref name=Tolkiendil>{{webcite|author=Association Tolkiendil|articleurl=https://www.tolkiendil.com/langues/english/i-lam_arth/compound_sindarin_names|articlename=Compound Sindarin Names in Middle-earth|website=Tolkiendil|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref> It is probably a compound of the prefix ''[[ara|ar(a)-]]'' ("noble", "royal", "high") and ''[[morn]]'' ("black", "dark", "night")<ref name=Tolkiendil/> or ''born'' ("[stead]fast").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-3046359413.html|articlename=S. ''Aravorn'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=05 February 2022}}</ref><ref>{{HM|GS}}, p. 342</ref>
